content:
• Friday, September 28, 2018
  • BEBE

    Bebe +2.5% after special dividend; company shuffles board

    • Bebe stores (OTC:BEBE) is getting a lift after hours, up 2.5%, following a special dividend it's issuing, alongside some news about changes to the board.
    • The company will pay a special dividend of $0.25/share, based on trailing two quarters of licensing income from its joint venture BB Brand Holdings.
    • The dividend is payable Oct. 24 to shareholders of record as of the close on Oct. 10.
    • Meanwhile, in board changes effective on Sept. 30, Nick Capuano will be made chairman; and Robert Galvin will resign from the board, to be replaced by Darrin Klotz.
    • Capuano will be continue to be joined on the board by Manny Mashouf, Corrado Federico and Kenny Young.
    • The board is also dissolving the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee and the Compensation Committee.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:01 PM
  • AMRN

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (09/28/2018)

    • Top Gainers: AMRN +6.6%. LEVB +5.7%. GBR +5.5%. SYN +4.6%. GOL +3%.
    • Top Losers: DVMT -4.1%. XNCR -4%. URGN -3.7%. KODK -3.2%. BTU -2.3%.

  • INSM

    Insmed shares halted pending news

    • Nasdaq has suspended trading in Insmed (NASDAQ:INSM) pending the release of news, a near certainty that it is related to the pending FDA approval for ALIS for nontuberculous mycobacteria (NTM) lung disease.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM | 3 Comments
  • BB

    Morgan Stanley rains on BlackBerry parade with cautious note

    • Sounding a cautious note on a blockbuster day for BlackBerry (NYSE:BB) -- which rose 11.7% after its earnings beat this morning -- Morgan Stanley says the company's 2020 growth expectations are too high.
    • The firm's reiterating an Equal-Weight stance.
    • BlackBerry Technology Solutions provided the one growth spot among segment revenues (overall revenues dropped by double digits).
    • And the current pace for BTS 2020 estimates are too optimistic, analyst James Faucette says, without continued acceleration in licensing revenue into next year. He expects auto growth to decelerate in the second half as well, putting the weight on licensing shoulders to meet targets. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • He has a price target of $10, now representing 12.1% downside after today's run. (The stock closed at $11.38.)
    • BB is down 1.1% in postmarket trading.
    • Earnings call transcript
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 64 Comments
  • BTU

    Peabody Energy -14% as fire kills Q4 production at North Goonyella mine

    • Peabody Energy (BTU -13.9%) plunges following "indications" of a fire at part of its North Goonyella mine in Queensland, Australia, after some scheduled work earlier in the month.
    • North Goonyella operations, including the longwell move, had been interrupted and delayed last week by elevated gas levels.
    • The company says it is working in conjunction with others toward a plan to extinguish the fire and contain its impacts.
    • BTU says it does not expect production from North Goonyella in Q4 but it is too early to assess the full financial impact of the ongoing issue on future periods; the mine shipped 1.6M tons in 2016 and 2.9M tons in 2017.
    • With strong performance from other mines, BTU maintains its FY 2018 met coal sales volume targets of 11M-12M tons.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM | 14 Comments
  • RSSFF

    New chief at Affinor Growers

    • Affinor Growers (OTCQB:RSSFF -4.3%) announces that President & CEO Nick Brusatore has decided to step down to focus on a vertical farming project in Aruba. CFO Randy Minhas will succeed him. A search is underway for a new CFO.
    • Board member David Mack has also decided to depart.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM | 1 Comment
  • FB

    Reuters: Attempt to force Facebook Messenger wiretap fails

    • A U.S. court effort to force Facebook (FB -2.7%) to wiretap voice calls in its Messenger app recently failed, Reuters reports.
    • Sources tell Reuters the closely watched test case has gone against a joint federal/state task force charged with investigating criminal gang MS-13. The task force had tried to hold Facebook in contempt of court for refusing the wiretap order.
    • Telecom companies are required to give police access to calls under federal law, but that law exempts many apps relying solely on Internet infrastructure (as Facebook contends applies to Messenger).
    • The government had been intercepting ordinary phone calls and Messenger texts between the members, according to the public filings.
    • Previously: Facebook -2.6% after disclosing security problem (Sep. 28 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM | 28 Comments
  • AAPL

    Bloomberg: ITC judge finds Apple violates one Qualcomm patent

    • ITC judge finds Apple (AAPL +0.2%) infringes on one of three Qualcomm (QCOM +1%) patents but recommends against the requested import ban.
    • News is from a Bloomberg headline. More information to come when available.
    • Update:  International Trade Commission Judge Thomas Pender recommends no import ban be imposed if Apple products are found to infringe on Qualcomm’s patents. 
    • The findings are subject to a full commission review, which will have the final say.  
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 75 Comments
  • PHIL

    PHI Group +5.9% after ending one MOU in Vietnam and signing another

    • PHI Group (OTCPK:PHIL) jumps 5.9% in afternoon trading after terminating a memorandum of understanding with MHD Hanoi Investment JSC and signing another MOU with Saigon Pho Palace JSC for real estate development and other business activities in Vietnam.
    • PHI Group and SGP Palace will continue talks to reach definitive agreements in: assisting SGP Palace to go public in the U.S. and/or international stock markets; managing construction projects, including the contemplated Asia Diamond Exchange in Quang Nam Province,; jointly developing selective real estate projects; and working with international partners to provide construction materials with new technologies in Vietnam and other southeast Asian markets.
    • Previously: PHI Group spikes 31% after deal to form JV for offshore blockchain (July 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM

  • TTGT

    Raymond James starts TechTarget at 34% upside

    • Raymond James initiates TechTarget (NASDAQ:TTGT) at Outperform with a $26 price target, a 34% upside to yesterday’s close.
    • TechTarget’s Q2 report in August beat EPS and revenue estimates, but shares dropped immediately following the report with some investors feeling like the surprises weren’t enough. 
    • TechTarget shares are currently up 0.4% to $19.41, down 30.7% for the quarter, and up 39% YTD and 60.1% in the past year.       
    • Previously: TechTarget -10.5% after Q2 beats with in-line guide, analyst downgrade (Aug. 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM
  • AMRN

    Amarin up another 15%

    • Amarin (AMRN +15.3%) continues to build on its Monday moonshot following positive results for its fish oil capsule.
    • Shares about quadrupled on Monday, and with today's gain have added an additional 50% since.
    • The company is presenting at the Cantor Global Healthcare Conference on Wednesday.
    • Previously: Citi sees another 5x upside in Amarin (Sept. 24)
    • Previously: Amarin reports positive results from REDUCE-IT study; shares up 307% premarket (Sept. 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM | 36 Comments
  • KLAC

    Report: KLA-Tencor's Orbotech deal under Chinese antitrust review

    • KLA-Tencor’s (NASDAQ:KLAC) $3.4B Orbotech deal has been in an in-depth Phase 2 review by Chinese antitrust officials since late July.
    • Korea approved the deal in the middle of August and China was the next hurdle.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word/Capitol Forum sources. 
    • KLAC shares are up 0.6% to $101.51, one of the semi gainers after Intel’s supply update.       
    • Previously: AMD -4.5% on Intel's 10nm supply update (Sept. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM | 3 Comments
  • IOTS

    Adesto Technologies +2.4% on stake disclosure

    • Wellington Trust Company discloses a 5.05% stake in Adesto Technologies (NASDAQ:IOTS).
    • Adesto shares are up 2.4% to $5.89. 
       
     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • W

    Canaccord expects Wayfair rally to extend

    • Canaccord Genuity hikes its price target on Wayfair (W +2%) to $165 on a positive view of the online retailer's growth track.
    • "Wayfair's extensive build out of its delivery infrastructure brings a number of benefits, including faster and cheaper delivery, lower damage rate, and improved customer experience, all of which drive higher repeat rates and therefore higher customer life-time value," notes the firm.
    • Canaccord thinks the Wayfair investment cycle that started in 2015 is paying off as it points to the explosive direct retail revenue growth over the last few quarters.
    • Shares of Wayfair are up 85% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM

    Bojangles exploring sale - Reuters; shares rise 11%

    • Bojangles (BOJA +11.1%) has hired Bank of America to explore options, according to Reuters.

  • LGF.A

    Lions Gate rises as investor floats hope of Amazon takeover

    • Lions Gate Entertainment is sharply higher today (LGF.A +5.9%, LGF.B +6.1%) after a report that its No. 4 Class A investor raises hopes that the company's Amazon.com (AMZN +0.1%) partnership could lead to a takeover.
    • In an interview, John Kornitzer floated the possibility that the retail giant could swing in and deliver a long-awaited payday for investors in the mini-major studio, Bloomberg reports: "Who knows?"
    • The stock is "going to go way up" if it can string together a few quarters of good results, Kornitzer says.
    • He also floated Verizon (VZ -0.4%) as a possibility, though Verizon has said it's not interested in acquiring traditional entertainment companies.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM | 27 Comments
  • AC

    Financials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (09/28/2018)

  • FB

    Facebook -2.6% after disclosing security problem

    • Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) is rapidly slipping, down 2.6%, after disclosing a security issue it's discovered affecting nearly 50M accounts.
    • Attackers "exploited a vulnerability in Facebook’s code" related to "View As" -- Facebook's feature that lets users see what their profile looks like to other users. That vulnerability allowed malicious users to steal access tokens usable to take over people's accounts.
    • The company says its engineering team discovered the issue on Tuesday afternoon, and that it's already fixed the vulnerability and informed law enforcement. It's also reset the access tokens on the nearly 50M accounts, as well as on those of another 40M accounts that saw a "View As" lookup in the past year.
    • And it's temporarily disabling the "View As" feature amid a security review.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM | 98 Comments
  • SYN

    Midday Gainers / Losers (09/28/2018)

  • WPP

    Advertising stocks move further down on probe news

    • Advertising industry stocks are moving lower today after a drop into yesterday's close following word of a federal investigation into media-buying practices.
    • With the rest of the market slightly positive, WPP is down 1.6%; Omnicom (NYSE:OMC) is down 1.6% as well; Publicis Groupe (OTCQX:PUBGY) is down 1.1%; Interpublic Group (NYSE:IPG) is off 1.1%; and Havas owner Vivendi (OTCPK:VIVHY) is 1.6% lower in U.S. trading.
    • Havas says it won't comment on the report of the probe, but says while media buying has gotten increasingly complex, clients usually audit its records in order to “validate for themselves that we manage their accounts in accordance with our agreements with them." (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Liberum says in a note that it's interesting Havas was mentioned in the report as it's not known for U.S. media buying, suggesting "something specific" has drawn prosecutors. Media is the most important part of agency business, making up significant chunks of profits, it notes.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • SBLK

    Deutsche note sends Star Bulk carriers higher

    • Deutsche Bank sees the upside in Star Bulk Carriers (NASDAQ:SBLK) as maybe north of $50, according to a headline on Bloomberg.
    • Shares have jumped 5.7% to $14.43. in the past few minutes. North of $50 would mean about a 4-bagger.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM | 10 Comments
  • AP

    Ampco-Pittsburgh files registration statement for proposed rights offering

    • Ampco-Pittsburgh (AP -9.6%) has filed with the SEC a registration statement for a proposed rights offering to distribute to its shareholders non-transferable subscription rights to purchase up to $20.0M of units.
    • AP intends to use the net proceeds of the rights offering to repay a portion of the amounts outstanding under promissory notes maturing on Mar. 3, 2019 and its revolving credit and security agreement and other general corporate purposes.
    • Press Release

  • TEUM

    Pareteum +2.2% after Artilium deal gets court OK

    • Pareteum (NYSEMKT:TEUM) is rising to session highs, up 2.2%, after news that its acquisition of all of Artilium (via a court-sanctioned scheme of arrangement) has gotten sacntioned by the court.
    • The effective date of the scheme is expected to be Oct. 1
    • Pareteum reached a deal in June to acquire Artilium for $104.7M, a few months after the two companies formed an alliance that led to several sales wins.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM | 1 Comment
  • INTC

    AMD -4.5% on Intel's 10nm supply update

    • Intel (INTC +2.9%) provides a supply update that includes news that the company is making progress with 10nm with yields improving and volume production still expected in 2019. The 10nm delay has proven a tailwind for rival AMD (NASDAQ:AMD), which is down 4.5% on the news.
    • Intel confirms that chip supplies are tight in part due to the “surprising return to PC TAM growth.” The company will prioritize production of Intel Xeon and Core processors and believes it has at least the supply to meet the FY revenue outlook.
    • To cope with the shortage, Intel is investing $15B in capex this year, up $1B form the beginning of the year. 
    • Other chip stocks on the move: (ICHR +3.2%), (AMAT +1.1%), (HIMX +1.2%), (MRVL +1%), (OLED +1.1%), (SGH +1.3%), (LRCX +0.6%).   
    • Previously: RBC presents AMD bull case; reports of sell-side firm questioning share gain (Sept. 24)
    • Previously: Raymond James downgrades Intel on 10nm delay (Sept. 25)
    • Previously: Bernstein cautious on chips, favoring Broadcom, Nvidia (Sept. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM | 310 Comments
  • ADMP

    Adamis investors "sell on the news" following FDA nod for low-dose Symjepi; shares down 17%

    • In a textbook example of selling on the news, Adamis Pharmaceuticals (ADMP -16.8%) is down on more than double normal volume following FDA approval for its low-dose Symjepi, announced after the close yesterday. Shares had rallied almost 90% before then.
    • Previously: FDA OKs Adamis Pharma's low-dose Symjepi (Sept. 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM | 18 Comments
  • IPGP

    IPG Photonics -1.7% as Longbow drops to Neutral

    • IPG Photonics (NASDAQ:IPGP) is 1.7% lower alongside a downgrade to Neutral at Longbow.
    • That's down from a previous rating of Buy.
    • Also in the background is a sharp drop by peer Applied Optoelectronics, down double digits after slashing its Q3 revenue view.
    • IPGP is down 25.8% on the year, largely due to a slide after its Q2 miss in July.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM | 2 Comments
  • AAOI

    Applied Opto -13% on revenue guidance; bull Raymond James downgrades

    • Applied Optoelectronics (NASDAQ:AAOI) has tumbled 13.2% after slashing its Q3 revenue estimates due to suspending shipments on some transceivers.
    • Raymond James has taken its Strong Buy off the stock, trimming its recommendation to Outperform and slashing its price target (to $40 from $51, which still implies "just" 62.5% upside).
    • Some optical-equipment peers are lower alongside: Lumentum Holdings (NASDAQ:LITE) is off 2.2%, Oclaro (NASDAQ:OCLR) is 1.1% lower and Infinera (NASDAQ:INFN) is down 1.6%.
    • Others are escapting any downdraft: Finisar (NASDAQ:FNSR) +1.4%; Acacia Communications (NASDAQ:ACIA) +0.8%; Fabrinet (NYSE:FN) flat; NeoPhotonics (NYSE:NPTN) +0.6%; Ciena (NASDAQ:CIEN) +0.5%; II-VI (NASDAQ:IIVI) +1%; Viavi (NASDAQ:VIAV) +0.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM | 19 Comments
  • AC

    Associated Capital +13% as it begins exchange offer to reduce Gamco stake

    • Associated Capital Group (AC +13.2%) soars after it begins an offer to exchange up to 1.8M shares of its class A common stock for shares it holds in Gamco Investors (NYSE:GBL) class A common stock.
    • Under the offer each holder tendering will get 1.9 shares of GBL class A stock for each AC share.
    • The exchange offer represents a 20% premium to AC's closing price Thursday of $38.40. GBL class A shares closed at $24.33 on the same day. GBL -4.2%.
    • AC currently holds about 3.73M shares of GBL class A common stock.
    • If the exchange offer is fully subscribed, AC will beneficially own 306,250 GBL shares, or about 3% of GBL class A common stock shares outstanding after the offer. If the offer is oversubscribed, AC's stake in GBL class A shares will be about 2%.
    • Previously: Associated Capital says Gamco PIK note extinguished; explores exchange offer (Aug. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM

    Synthetic Biologics up 161%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Synthetic Biologics (SYN +161.3%) is up on a whopping 83x surge in volume on no particular news.
    • 10 days ago, it filed a preliminary prospectus for a $40M equity offering.
    • At the end of June, it had $7.1M in cash and equivalents while operations consumed $10.4M in H1.

  • ING

    European banks sink as Italy set for battle with EU over budget

    • Europe banks and financials drop as the stage is set for a EU-Italy battle over Italy's proposed budget deficit of 2.4% of GDP for the next three years, a higher level the previous administration's target.
    • The iShares MSCI Europe Financial ETF (NASDAQ:EUFN) slumps 2.4%, its biggest decline since August 9. YTD return is -7.1%. The euro weakens 0.5% against the U.S. dollar at 0.86 euros to the greenback.
    • Dutch bank ING Groep (NYSE:ING) loses 3.3%, while Deutsche Bank (NYSE:DB) falls 3.1% and Banco Santander (NYSE:SAN) drops 2.7%. Lloyds Bank (NYSE:LYG) -2.9%.
    • Insurers also weaken: Allianz SE (OTCPK:AZSEY -3.3%), Prudential Plc (PUK -2.4%), AXA SA (OTCQX:AXAHY -3%).
    • The decline is more subdued in U.S. financials, with the Financial Select Sector SPDR ETF (NYSEARCA:XLF) down 0.6%.
    • European financial ETFs: EUFN, EUFL
    • Euro ETFs: FXE, EUO, OTC:ERO, DRR, ULE, EUFX, URR, DEUR, UEUR
    • Previously: Italy plunges more than 4%, bond yields shoot higher (Sept. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM | 24 Comments

    Leafbuyer spikes on huge volume

    • Leafbuyer Technologies (OTCQB:LBUY) is up 27% to break back over $2 for the first time since late February.
    • Volume on LBUY is almost 8X normal activity after just one hour of trading.

    Omnicom -2.6% as Barclays cuts to Underweight

    Ceragon Networks +12.3% as Oppenheimer bumps to Outperform

    • Ceragon Networks (NASDAQ:CRNT) has jumped 12.3% this morning after an upgrade by Oppenheimer to Outperform, from Market Perform.
    • The firm has a price target of $4.50, now implying 34% upside from current price.
    • That new recommendation has missed a move up this year, with CRNT up 53.5% in 2018 and up 60% over the past 12 months.

  • AEHR

    Aehr Test Systems down 5% post Q1 earnings miss

    • Aehr Test Systems (AEHR -5.6%) reported Q1 sales decrease of 32% Y/Y to $4.7M, impacted by couple of key shipments that pushed into Q2.
    • Q1 Gross margin declined by 910 bps to 32.8% and operating margin declined by 3,290 bps to -30.4%.
    • Inventories were $9.6M as of August 31, 2018, compared to $9M last quarter.
    • Bookings totaled $2.3M and Backlog was $6.1M as of August 31, 2018.
    • Company has cash and cash equivalents of $15.86M, compared to $16.85M last quarter.
    • Received a $2.7M follow-on order from one of the lead FOX-XP Test and Burn-in System customers for a FOX- XP Multi-Wafer Test and Burn-in System and WaferPak Aligner.
    • FY19 Outlook: Revenue $30-35M; GAAP profit range between break-even and $2.5M.
    • Previously: Aehr Test Systems misses by $0.04, misses on revenue (Sept. 27)

  • Italy plunges more than 4%, bond yields shoot higher

    • Rattling markets in Europe (but not so much over here), the Italian government significantly boosted its budget-deficit target for next year. That has some wondering about the sustainability of the government's funding.
    • Italy's FTSE MIB Index is down 4.45%, and the yield on the country's 10-year paper is higher by 33 basis points to 3.22%. Spanish 10-year notes, by contrast, yield just 1.51%. Germany's at 0.46% (down 7 basis points today).
    • The Stoxx 600 is lower by 1.1%, with Spain (NYSEARCA:EWP) down 2%, Germany (NYSEARCA:EWG) 1.9%, and France (NYSEARCA:EWQ) 1.4%.
    • Previously: Italy's new deficit target rattles European markets (Sept. 28)
    • ETFs: VGK, HEDJ, FEZ, EZU, IEV, EPV, IEUR, EURL, FEU, DBEU, HEZU, EEA, FEEU, FEP, UPV, ADRU, FEUZ, DBEZ, FIEU, DEZU, GSEU, PTEU, FIEE, HFXE, BBEU, EDOM, FLEE, RFEU
